question: I am a mother of three children. My husband is a traveller, and often he is out of home for many days. In his absence, I experience the following difficulties.
answer:
QUESTION
I am a mother of three children. My husband is a traveller, and often he is out of home for many days. In his absence, I experience the following difficulties due to not being able to drive: i) Lift for my children going and returning to school, ii) Going to the Doctor, iii) Purchasing basic necessities. In view of the abovementioned and other similar difficulties, is it permissible for me to drive?
ANSWER


Share:
In principle, a female should stay within the confines of her home. It is
not permissible for her to emerge from her home without dire need and
necessity and without observing Hijaab (Purdah).
In dire need and necessity (approved by the Shari'ah), it is permissible for
a female to drive within 88 km. with the following conditions: i) There is
no alternative, ii) There is no apparent fear of life/respect; and, iii)
Adhering to the laws of Hijaab. (Al-Ashbah Wannazaair pg.252; Idaratul Qur'
aan)
It is not permissible for a female to drive in the absence of any one of the
abovementioned conditions.

From: Al Mahmood 13 Q & A from the Darul Ifta
Mufti Ebrahim Desai
